# Cesare Borgia

**Type:** Person
**Confidence:** 96%

## Summary

Son of Pope Alexander, known for his political maneuvers in Italy. Commonly known as Duke Valentino, he acquired his state through the influence of his father but struggled to maintain it after that influence waned. Cesare Borgia is cited as an example of a leader who initially relied on auxiliary troops but later shifted to mercenaries and his own forces. A historical figure referenced as an example of a prince whose cruelty brought order and stability.
